answers.answer: The support program dedicated to Ukrainians living in Romania changed as of July 1, 2024.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: The new financial support program for beneficiaries of temporary protection is the Monthly Lump Sum for Accommodation.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the section under 'Monthly Lump Sum for Accommodation'.

answers.answer: Ukrainians may be eligible for accommodation support for up to 3 consecutive months, starting July 1, 2024.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the section under 'Monthly Lump Sum for Accommodation'.

answers.answer: Lump sum payments do not apply to beneficiaries receiving international protection, individuals residing in temporary accommodation camps provided by the government, or those who previously received accommodation benefits under old regulations.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the section under 'Exclusions'.

answers.answer: The monthly lump sum payment for families is 2,000 RON per month.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the section under 'Amount'.

answers.answer: For special cases, financial assistance is 500 RON per month for individuals and 1,500 RON per month for families.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the section under 'Special Cases'.

answers.answer: Required documents include a valid temporary protection permit, passports for each family member, bank account details from a Romanian bank in RON currency, and any other documents requested by local authorities.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the section under 'Required Documents'.

answers.answer: Beneficiaries must submit their application to the local administrative-territorial unit, filling in the application form, providing personal details including CNP numbers, attaching proof of temporary protection, a bank account statement, and indicating they are not residing in a temporary accommodation camp.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the section under 'Application Process'.

answers.answer: The application for the first month's payment should be submitted within the first 5 working days of the first month.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the section under 'Notes'.

answers.answer: You cannot benefit from accommodation support if you are a Romanian citizen, reside in a university dormitory as a student, or have a work permit or student residence permit in Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the section under 'Exclusions for Rent Payment Support'.

answers.answer: The Minimum Inclusion Income is an ongoing financial support program available to beneficiaries after their lump sum period ends, or for those who previously received benefits, provided under Law No. 196/2016.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the section under 'Transition to Minimum Inclusion Income'.

answers.answer: Ukrainians can find free accommodation by using the 'Un Acoperi»ô (A Roof)' platform, where central authorities and international organizations coordinate requests and provide housing.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the section under 'Assistance in finding housing'.

answers.answer: Ukrainians can ask Romanian/English speakers for translation, contact an NGO with multilingual speakers, or call a multilingual call center. Specific government, UNHCR, and CNRR phone numbers are also provided for additional details.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/the-5020-program and read the page carefully.
